quest.name: Boys with Boats
journal: Tansui's face betrays nothing as he looks you up and down.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Ugh... My clothes have mostly dried, but they're a bit clingy. Still, no regrets!

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I wonder─Lominsan pirates have been known to say things like, “Arrr,” but surely pirates on the opposite side of the world would use different expressions? “Errr,” or “Urrr,” or “Arururu,” perhaps?

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: Doma's position on the Confederacy could be best described as one of “guarded acceptance.” They are pirates, aye, but they adhere to a code and are a stabilizing force in the Ruby Sea.

dialogue.name: SOROBAN
dialogue.text: As he says, there is business to be discussed.

dialogue.name: TANSUI
dialogue.text: You wish to pay the Ruby Tithe, yes? With your...gil, perhaps? It is just as well. Foreign currencies are in demand these days.

dialogue.name: SOROBAN
dialogue.text: I would pay for their passage to Othard.

dialogue.name: SOROBAN
dialogue.text: Does this sum meet with your satisfaction?

dialogue.name: TANSUI
dialogue.text: ...The sea has been quite tempestuous of late. I cannot say with confidence that you would reach your destination safely─unless you tripled it.

dialogue.name: SOROBAN
dialogue.text: D-Do you take me for a fool? I know the price, as do all!

dialogue.name: TANSUI
dialogue.text: Alas, we live in interesting times. As you came from Kugane, I should think I need not tell you that.

dialogue.name: TANSUI
dialogue.text: The shadow of war looms. The wise and the cautious shirk our waters and our custom, and the foolhardy sharpen their knives in anticipation.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Meaning...?

dialogue.name: TESHITAPIRATE
dialogue.text: Sir! Sir! You've got to come quickly. The bastards're at it again!

dialogue.name: TESHITAPIRATE
dialogue.text: I tried to convince them to stop, but they weren't having it.

dialogue.name: TANSUI
dialogue.text: <sigh> Very well. I will be there shortly.

dialogue.name: TANSUI
dialogue.text: ...Hm. A proposition. Your comrades strike me as a worthwhile investment. I would not hear men name me a cat before koban, so I shall consider their tithe paid─not for what they have done, but for what I expect they will do.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I'm not sure what to make of that man, but at least the matter of our tithe is settled. For now.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: What was that he and the other pirate were talking about? Maybe we ought to go and have a look.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: That's Tansui over there, isn't it?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Do you know what this is all about?

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: Hmm...I have been away for some time, so...

dialogue.name: SOROBAN
dialogue.text: I...I am not certain this is a wise idea...

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: So they really don't care what happens to Doma? I can't...I refuse to believe that.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Doma is but one of many provinces under imperial control, filled with people who have had to find ways to cope with a bitter reality...

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: What are we waiting for? Come, come! Soroban cannot have gone far!

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: ...Though now that I think on it, it is passing strange that he left without warning. Mayhap he did not wish to be seen by his Kojin brethren?

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: I doubt he thought to leave us behind, but nevertheless, it may be prudent to return to his ship. Or at least to the Confederate encampment.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Oh good, he's still here!

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I am sure he has his reasons for his odd behavior...and I should like very much to hear them. Trust requires honesty.

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: Hah! I told you he would not abandon us!

dialogue.name: SOROBAN
dialogue.text: Oh, my friends! A thousand pardons! ...As you may have guessed, I was reluctant to be seen in your company by my Red brothers. Ours is a...complex relationship.

dialogue.name: SOROBAN
dialogue.text: I pray you do not misinterpret their actions as a reflection of our allegiances as a whole.

dialogue.name: SOROBAN
dialogue.text: You...you understand? Kami be praised! Too often are shell-less quick to judge all Kojin for the deeds of one.

dialogue.name: SOROBAN
dialogue.text: Right, then. Now that our business with Tansui is concluded, we can traverse the Ruby Sea without fear!
